document_data.name: Stench Ghoul
document_data.mainbody: '''Stench ghouls''', were an intelligent subtype of [[ghoul]] that existed in the period between the [[Spellplague]] and the [[Second Sundering]]. They arose from the corpses of [[humanoid]] cannibals that died from eating rancid humanoid flesh.
document_data.Description: The most distinguishing feature of a stench ghoul was the incredibly nauseating smell that constantly emanated from its body.
document_data.Combat: Beyond using their stench tactically, this subtype fought in the typical ghoul manner of biting and slashing with claws.
document_data.History: In the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]], a group of [[Daggerdale]]smen [[adventurer]]s traveling up the [[Tower of the Void]] were alerted of the presence of ghouls and a particularly potent stench surrounding them by the brigand [[Madder Belebrix]]. After fighting through a number of groups of ghouls and [[plaguechanged ghoul]]s the adventurers came to find the debilitating smell was coming from a stinking ghoul that towered over them in size.
document_data.Society: These ghouls were typically found in areas with rich amounts of carrion, such as battlefields and graveyards. Due to their great intelligence they were often found commanding packs of other ghouls. Beyond the [[Prime Material]] they could be found in the city of [[Evernight]], the [[Shadowfell]]'s reflection of [[Neverwinter]].<ref>
